pages.body:
# The New ZeroWiki

This is a clone of [[ZeroWiki]] created with better organization and information-richness in mind.
[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[BitTorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public and [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

If you want to contribute to the wiki, go to the [[Contributing to this Wiki]] page for guidelines. If you don't know where to categorize a page, link to the page from the [[Uncategorized Pages]] page. You can use the [[Sandbox]] page to test out editing ZeroWiki pages.

# Wikis | [[Zite Categories]]

A **wiki** is a type of website in which users can edit and contribute to its content. Examples of wikis include Wikipedia, Wiktionary, ZeroWiki and the Debian Wiki. The word 'wiki' comes from Hawaiian, meaning fast or quickly. Wikis are increasingly popular with community groups and small organizations, and are recognized as a type of 'Web 2.0' site.

Most wiki's are typically a collection of information on a specific subject such as Linux or many different subjects such as everything from Pizza to The origin of the Internet.

* [Original ZeroWiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP)
* [ZeroTuto](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/)
* [Kiwipedia](/1KiwiBCVBUcuypVm8FEmUW9YT6fJDXkN9r)

# content.json | [[ZeroNet]]

`content.json` is the main file in [[Zite|zite]] that contains all metadata about site.

## Example content.json

```json
{
 "address": "1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t",
 "address_index": 80074647,
 "background-color": "#FFF",
 "clone_root": "template-new",
 "cloned_from": "1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D",
 "description": "Testing Git Center!",
 "domain": "gitcenter.bit",
 "favicon": "img/logo.png",
 "files": {
  "index.html": {
   "sha512": "0778eea5e329d0f209ce9518d437e801b3c1ed2d1f2de9e4da01591fab7e02e2",
   "size": 2093
  }
 },
 "inner_path": "content.json",
 "modified": 1516199309,
 "postmessage_nonce_security": true,
 "signers_sign": "HGi2ieQAyGsfO7LeAVgbnd2tJAqB15an3uspuYTlJVSMUCEkQjs2wzhEY9sW3z7LTfS24oyDRVEnQ7KdzADbGRI=",
 "signs": {
  "1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t": "HD0BbTfRCkSPtx5+4Zi36tjZPe597FLk8h/0okPA7tsDQdxThEwGOCAMOOIhAui9AFqy1yDhNg4+9JwPO5wrMFc="
 },
 "signs_required": 1,
 "title": "My site",
 "zeronet_version": "0.6.0"
}
```

## Meaning

### address

`address` contains [[zite]] address.

## address_index

`address_index` is a random number generated on site creation (or [[cloning]]).

## background-color

The color that is set as background. Can be replaced by manual `background-color` in CSS.

## clone_root, cloned_from

`cloned_from` is the address of [[zite]] from which another [[zite]] was [[cloning|cloned]], and `clone_root` is the subdirectory of clone origin.

Cloning via [[ZeroHello]] results in cloning root directory, so `clone_root` is empty. Site creation is the same as [[cloning]] `template-new` directory of [[ZeroHello]], so `clone_root` is `template_new`.

## description

Site description.

## domain

[[Namecoin]] domain assigned to site. Set by owner, so registering domain doesn't trigger adding such entry.

## favicon

Address to site [[favicon]].

## files

An array containing metadata of all files.

## inner_path

Path of current file local to site.

## modified

Timestamp of modification date. Set by owner, so sometimes cannot be trusted.

## signers_sign

DEPRECATED

## signs

Pairs of signer address and sign.

## signs_required

Count of signs needed to distribute site. Used for [[Multisig|multisig]] which wasn't implemented yet, though.

## title

Title of site.

## zeronet_version

ZeroNet version of site owner (or signer).


## files

## inner_path

## modified

Timestamp of modification date. Set by owner, so sometimes cannot be trusted.

## signs_required

## title

## zeronet_version

# ZeroNet Dev Center

[ZeroNet Dev Center](/14pM9huTYzJdyQyHRj6v2kfhMe8DrxwpGt) is [[Krixano]]'s second zite created to provide more resources for learning how to develop for [[ZeroNet]]. It currently features a few tutorials written by three different people in total, including [[Lola]], [[Glightstar]], and Krixano himself, as well as a place, similar to [[Stack Overflow]], where you can ask development questions. Afterwards, *questions* part was released separately as [[ZeroExchange]].

# ZeroNet Dev Center

[ZeroNet Dev Center](/14pM9huTYzJdyQyHRj6v2kfhMe8DrxwpGt) is [[Krixano]]'s second zite created to provide more resources for learning how to develop for [[ZeroNet]]. It currently features a few tutorials written by three different people in total, including [[Lola]], [[Glightstar]], and Krixano himself, as well as a place, similar to [[Stack Overflow]], where you can ask development questions.

# ThunderWave | [[ZeroNet]]

[ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit/) is a real-time chat in [[ZeroNet]] developed by [[Glightstar]]. It has support for group and private chats and lobby.

# Important Zites | [[ZeroNet]]

[Important Zites](/15Pf9VVuDT8NSWj1qUBh4V89yPmrmzRw6a), created by [[Krixano]], was a zite that listed the most important and useful zites by category. It was created before [[ZeroSites]]. You were able to select a category from a menu on the side to filter out the list. Later, a search feature was added with the ability to open the first zite listed in a new tab when you press Enter. Eventually, Krixano added the ability to request zites be added or removed. After ZeroSites was released, the zite was rarely updated.

# CodeR | [[ZeroNet]]

CodeR is an alternative to [[CodePen]] and [[JSFiddle]] developed by [[Ivanq]].

## Links

[CodeR](/1CodEr7T9xNXSPcwbsvf5fHTqsixDMwDzL/)

# Git Center | [[ZeroNet]]

Git Center is a git hosting by [[Ivanq]], which provides public/private repositories. This is the first git hosting on [[ZeroNet]].

## Links

[Git Center](/gitcenter.bit/)

# Git Center | [[ZeroNet]]

Git Center is a git hosting by [[Ivanq]], which provides public/private repositories. This is the first git hosting on [[ZeroNet]].

## Links

[Git Center](/gitcenter.bit/)

# Zites | [[ZeroNet]]

A Zite is a [[ZeroNet]] [[website]]. Zites have the notable difference of being entirely [[decentralized]] and work even if the visitor is offline. Zites are designed to be entirely [[open source]] and freely shared. Zite owners can also make their site [[cloning|cloneable]]. This ensures content is not censored and cannot be forcefully taken down.

However, due to how the site is distributed and viewed, sites must be entirely contained within local [[HTML]] and [[JavaScript]] files. Information for the site can be stored in an [[SQLite]] database or in [[JSON]] files.

Zites require the private key generated with the address in order to be edited or published. Users of the zite have a subdirectory they may edit within the zite's file structure.

[KEEP THIS?]
[ZeroTuto](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x), is a great resource for creating zites.

Various attempts have been made to index and search the hundreds of zites that have been created. [[Search engine|Search engines]] like [[Kaffiene]] or [[ZeroSearch]] allow searching through hand-crafted indexes using key terms. While other zites, like [[0list]] or [[ZeroCentral]], allow user submissions to generate a list.

# ZeroMail | [[ZeroNet]]

ZeroMail is a [[peer-to-peer]] messaging service by [[Nofish]]. It uses encryption algorithms such as [[AES]] and [[ECIES]] and [[zeronet-id-providers|auth provider]] [[ZeroID]].

# ZeroBoard | [[ZeroNet]]

ZeroBoard is a real-time chat created by [[Nofish]].

Though it is running in ZeroNet, [[Clearnet]] site is used to send messages. [[peer-to-peer|P2P]] technology is used to recieve content, not to send it.

Being outdated (as soon as multiuser sites were added to [[ZeroNet]]), there were discussions on replacing [[Clearnet]] site with [[zeronet-id-providers|ID support]].

# ZeroID | [[ZeroNet]]

ZeroID is an [[zeronet-id-providers|ID provider]] created by [[Nofish]].

ZeroID has [[ClearNet]] domain [zeroid.qc.to](https://zeroid.qc.to/). When user is registered, a confirmation is sent to that site, which means it can be blocked.

## Links

[GitHub repository](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroID/)

# 0list | [[ZeroNet]]

[0list](/0list.bit/), also know as ZeroList, is an index for [[zites]]. It is a kind of forum, cloned from [[ZeroTalk]].

Maintained by community and not moderated, many sites are specified several times on 0list. It has no searching features as well.

In 2017, this was replaced by [[ZeroSites]].

# Zites | [[ZeroNet]]

A Zite is a [[ZeroNet]] [[website]]. Zites have the notable difference of being entirely [[decentralized]] and work even if the visitor is offline. Zites are designed to be entirely [[open source]] and freely shared. Zite owners can also make their site [[cloning|cloneable]]. This ensures content is not censored and cannot be forcefully taken down.

However, due to how the site is distributed and viewed, sites must be entirely contained within local [[HTML]] and [[JavaScript]] files. Information for the site can be stored in an [[SQLite]] database or in [[JSON]] files.

Zites require the private key generated with the address in order to be edited or published. Users of the zite have a subdirectory they may edit within the zite's file structure.

[KEEP THIS?]
[ZeroTuto](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x), is a great resource for creating zites.

Various attempts have been made to index and search the hundreds of zites that have been created. [[Search engine|Search engines]] like [[Kaffiene]] or [[ZeroSearch]] allow searching through hand-crafted indexes using key terms. While other zites, like [[0list]] or [[ZeroCentral]], allow user submissions to generate a list.

# The New ZeroWiki

This is a clone of [[ZeroWiki]] created with better organization and information-richness in mind.
[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[BitTorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public and [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

If you want to contribute to the wiki, go to the [[Contributing to this Wiki]] page for guidelines. If you don't know where to categorize a page, link to the page from the [[Uncategorized Pages]] page. You can use the [[Sandbox]] page to test out editing ZeroWiki pages.
